main event: An Air Force pilot observed a rapidly moving bluish-white light over Laredo, Texas, on December 4, 1952, while conducting training exercises.
interesting points: The object made a close head-on pass at the pilot's aircraft, missing it by about 50 yards., The light was described as flickering and moving at a very high rate of speed., The observer attempted to locate the object again but was unable to do so., The incident was reported to have unusual characteristics inconsistent with known aircraft or meteor behavior., The official conclusion suggested the object was probably a balloon or aircraft due to insufficient data.
witness description: 1st Lt. Robert O. Arnold, a pilot from the 3646th Pilot Training Wing
